## R Markdown

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library("tidyverse")
library("janitor")
```

```{r}
bison_data <- read_csv("data/bison.csv")
```
```{r}
dim(bison_data)
```
```{r}
glimpse(bison_data)
```
```{r}
new_bison_data <- select(bison_data, "animal_code", "animal_sex", "animal_weight", "animal_yob")
new_bison_data
```
### Ledford's example of piping in class but the previous code also works
```{r}
bison_new <- bison_data %>%
  select(animal_code, animal_sex, animal_weight, animal_yob)
```
### Ledford's example:
```{r}
bison_new %>%
  filter(animal_yob>= 1980 & animal_yob<= 1990)
```

### My example
```{r}
newest_bison_data <- new_bison_data %>%
  filter(between(animal_yob, 1980, 1990))%>%
  arrange(animal_yob)
```

```{r}
table(newest_bison_data$animal_sex)
```

mean(M$animal_weight)
